question.text: Which of the following is incorrect about Cynobacteria?

options.text: They often form blooms in polluted water bodies
They have chlorophyll-<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></math> similar to green plants

solution.text: The cyanobacteria or blue-green algae (<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>BGA</mi></math>) have chlorophyll-<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></math> similar to green plants and are photosynthetic autotrophs. The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>BGA</mi></math> are unicellular, colonial or filamentous, freshwater, marine or terrestrial algae. The colonies are generally surrounded by a gelatinous sheath. They often form blooms in polluted water bodies. Some of these organisms can fix atmospheric nitrogen in a specialised cells called heterocysts.
